number of helpful: 4 of 4 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21
												well,for some reason,this game works for me on my AMD FX 8320 and my dying HD 7850.As for the game.You need to set all .exe files (yes this game has like 5 .exe files) to win 98 comp mode WITHOUT admin rights.I don't know how that works,but if you set it to run with admin rights,same crashes too.It's a pain to run on modern systems,but if you get it working,you have quite good racing game.Alot of bugs,for sure.On modern system sometimes the road starts to fade away,but can be fixed with extreme nitro.I'd give this game 10/10 because it has pimpin' rides and xzibit type of customization,and more story than The Last of Us.but,really,If the game works,I give it a 6/10 ok get it when it's like 99 cents.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2016
												I forget where I bought the disc for this, but for whatever reason I remember that it actually ran on my (old) laptop.Surprisingly, it was a fun game I guess, a need for speed - esque game with some cool and detailed customization. The map was pretty nice too.However definitely don't buy it. Nothing about this game works properly and it can't be fixed. And nobody capable of fixing the problem cares enough about it's existence to do it for you.Some day I would like to see this game be playable, but it's probably never going to come.I spent all of 3 dollars on this at sale value and I wasted time just seeing if there was anything I could do. Valusoft doesn't care. And that's time I'm never getting back.If the game looks cool, it is to a degree. But it can't be played it. It's a universal issue with most of the people playing it, especially on new hardware.
